text: Playbook: What the GOP's new Big 3 discussed this weekend  —  With help from Eli Okun, Garrett Ross and Bethany Irvine  —  DRIVING THE DAY  —  TOP-ED — “The Price of American Retreat,” by Mitch McConnell for Foreign Affairs: “To pretend that the United States can focus on just one threat at a time …

Congress grapples over pre-Christmas catch-all deal as government shutdown looms  —  Top lawmakers had aimed to release bill text over the weekend but hit an impasse over agriculture aid.  —  Congressional leaders were still trading offers Sunday afternoon on a government funding patch attached …

Journalists anticipate a renewed hostility toward their work under the incoming Trump administration  —  For the press heading into a second Trump administration, there's a balancing act between being prepared and being fearful.  The return to power of Donald Trump, who has called journalists enemies …

Trump vows to ‘hire American.’ His businesses keep hiring foreign guest workers  —  President-elect Donald Trump vowed on the campaign trail to do everything in his power to benefit American workers.  “We will build American, buy American and hire American,” he said during a rally in August.

Why Musk Doesn't Have Access to SpaceX's Biggest Government Secrets  —  Executives haven't sought higher security clearance for the CEO to avoid questions about his drug use and contact with foreign officials; the answers might no longer matter  —  The payloads SpaceX launches into the heavens …

Amazon Disregarded Internal Warnings on Injuries, Senate Investigation Claims  —  A staff report by the Senate labor committee, led by Bernie Sanders, uncovered evidence of internal concern about high injury rates at the e-commerce giant.  —  For years, worker advocates and some government officials …

How Pam Bondi boosted Trump's election fraud claims in a key swing state  —  In Pennsylvania in 2020, Trump's pick for attorney general pushed baseless claims of widespread voting fraud  —  On the morning of Nov. 4, 2020, former Florida Attorney General Pam Bondi drove northeast from Washington …
Steve Bannon Is Already Claiming Trump Can Run Again in 2028  —  WHO'S GONNA STOP ME?  —  The political strategist says the Constitution doesn't count in this case.

Tax Cuts Take Lead Over Deficit Worries in GOP's Internal Fight  —  Republicans embrace the contentious idea that some of their tax cuts would largely pay for themselves  —  WASHINGTON—Tax cutters are beating deficit hawks in the early phases of the Republican Party's fiscal tug of war.

Speaker Johnson faces ‘complicated’ decision on crucial Rules Committee chair  —  Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) is barreling into a tricky — yet critical — decision over whom to appoint as the next chair of the House Rules Committee, a post that will set the tone for legislating and play …

Trump girds for battle with Democrats, Supreme Court over birthright citizenship  —  President-elect Trump, Democratic lawmakers and the Supreme Court are on a collision course over restricting birthright citizenship, which Trump has identified as a top priority for his incoming administration.

His Family Voted to Support Trump's Deportation Plan.  That Includes Him.  —  His friends and family members in Rome, Ga., voted to support mass deportation.  Now he's scrambling to stay in the country.  —  Jaime Cachua with his son Julian.  He fears he will be deported.

Trump Allies Fear Watered Down Deportation Efforts  —  President-elect's team is committed to pursuing immigrants who crossed illegally, but is wary about logistical challenges and setting expectations  —  WASHINGTON—Donald Trump ran for president on a bold promise: to carry out the largest mass deportation in U.S. history.
